title: India approves viability gap funding scheme for battery storage development - pv magazine International
summary: The Union Cabinet of India has approved a VGF scheme for BESS development, aiming to develop 4 GWh of BESS projects by 2030-31 with financial support up to 40% of the project's capital cost. This is expected to reduce the cost of battery storage systems and increase their viability, targeting a levelized cost of storage of INR 5.50/kWh to INR 6.60/kWh.
